title: Joshua and Fury may drop titles to ensure fight happens, says Hearn
description: Promoter Eddie Hearn says Anthony Joshua and Tyson Fury may consider dropping all four world title belts to ensure their potential fight happens.

title: West Ham United 1-1 Crystal Palace: Christian Benteke sent off at London Stadium
description: West Ham's Sebastien Haller scores a spectacular overhead kick equaliser against Crystal Palace, who finish with 10 men after Christian Benteke's red card.

title: Firmino's late winner sends Liverpool clear of Spurs at top
description: Roberto Firmino puts Liverpool clear at the top of the Premier League table with a last-gasp winner against Tottenham.

title: 11,000 positive Covid tests missing from Welsh data
description: Public Health Wales warns IT maintenance has led to "significant under-reporting" of cases.

title: Lockerbie bombing: New suspect soon to be charged - US media
description: The US will unseal charges against a suspected bomb-maker behind the 1988 disaster, US media report.

title: St Mirren stun Rangers to reach Scottish League Cup semis
description: Conor McCarthy's dramatic injury-time winner ends Rangers' 27-game unbeaten start to the season and sends St Mirren through to a Scottish League Cup semi-final against Livingston.

title: Arsenal end losing run despite Gabriel red card against Southampton
description: Mikel Arteta hopes a battling draw against Southampton can be the start of Arsenal's recovery in the Premier League.

title: Covid Christmas risk 'hard to control'
description: Modelling suggests if most households get together in bubbles, infection rates could rise sharply.

title: 'My season rail pass has risen £12,000 since 1997'
description: Fares will rise more than expected next year, although the 2.6% increase will be delayed until March.

title: Brexit trade talks with India: 'We don't duck the difficult issues'
description: Dominic Rabb says the UK wants a post-Brexit trade deal with India, but will also hold it accountable for human rights issues.

title: The stars, the underdogs, the tracks - Jolyon Palmer's 2020 F1 review
description: Former F1 driver Jolyon Palmer picks out his standout aspects of the 2020 Formula 1 season.

title: Brexit trade talks: Could the UK and the EU keep negotiating?
description: What happens if there's a last-minute Brexit trade deal or they need to keep talking?

title: Covid-19 Vaccine: When are African countries getting it?
description: How and and when are African countries likely to get access to Covid-19 vaccines?

title: Could Brexit make my food more expensive?
description: The UK is negotiating a new trade deal with the EU - how might the result affect food prices?

title: Covid: What are the new rules for pubs and restaurants?
description: Pubs in Wales are to close again after Christmas Day.

title: PC Andrew Harper: Appeals against killers' sentences rejected
description: Judges reject an application by the attorney general to increase his killers' "lenient" sentences.

title: Covid: UK keeps Christmas rules but some advice changes
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson urges people to show "extreme caution" when celebrating.

title: Covid: Boxing Day sales off in Wales ahead of lockdown on 28 December
description: Non-essential shops will have to close from Christmas Eve, with a lockdown starting on 28 December.

title: Ella Kissi-Debrah: Air pollution a factor in girl's death, inquest finds
description: Ella Kissi-Debrah was "living on a knife edge" before her fatal asthma attack, the inquest heard.

title: Bilic sacked by second-bottom West Brom after 18 months in charge
description: West Brom manager Slaven Bilic is sacked after 18 months in charge, with the club next to bottom of the Premier League.

title: Covid-19: Europeans urged to wear masks for family Christmas
description: The WHO says Europe is at "high risk" of a new wave of infections in the New Year.

title: Ethnic minorities 'less likely to take Covid vaccine'
description: Conspiracy theories and false information are blamed for reluctance to take Covid vaccine.

title: Hyde Park bomb family awarded £715k damages
description: The ruling follows a civil case brought against John Downey, who was involved in the 1982 attack.

title: Julie Burchill's book about cancel culture cancelled over Twitter row
description: Julie Burchill's publisher says the writer "crossed a line with regard to race and religion".

title: Bird of prey rescued from indoor Christmas tree perch
description: The sparrowhawk was released back into the wild none the worse after becoming an unusual festive decoration.

title: Brexit: 'Narrow path' in view for trade deal - EU chief
description: The president of the EU Commission says the "next few days" will be decisive for trade negotiations.

title: Tom Cruise: Recording emerges of star 'shouting at film crew' over Covid
description: A recording emerges of the Mission: Impossible star apparently letting fly about social distancing.

title: Paris mayor mocks 'absurd' fine for hiring too many women
description: City mayor Anne Hidalgo mocks the "absurd" penalty for breaking equal employment rules.

title: African champion Foo Kune banned after failing to prove drink was spiked
description: African badminton champion Kate Foo Kune has been handed a two-year doping ban after failing to prove her drink was spiked.

title: Supreme Court lifts ban on Heathrow third runway
description: In a blow to campaigners, judges say ministers' decision to approve the runway was legitimate.

title: Glastonbury 2021: Emily Eavis says 'we're doing everything we can'
description: But "we're a long way from being able to say we're confident 2021 will go ahead," Emily Eavis says.

title: 'An online buy left our home destroyed by fire'
description: The Firth family are sure the blaze began with a battery pack bought on eBay, but the cause is not yet clear.

title: British actress Naomi Ackie to play Whitney Houston in film biopic
description: The Bafta winner will play the late singer in a new film biopic, I Wanna Dance With Somebody.

title: Sports Personality of the Year: Tyson Fury on beating Deontay Wilder to become heavyweight champion
description: Sports Personality of the Year contender Tyson Fury says there is more to come from him after he beat Deontay Wilder to become world heavyweight boxing champion.

title: Jones to continue role with Japanese club despite England's World Cup draw
description: England head coach Eddie Jones can continue as a consultant for Japanese Top League side Suntory Sungoliath, the Rugby Football Union says.

title: Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg: Is midfielder Spurs' most influential signing?
description: Has Spurs midfielder Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg had the biggest influence on Jose Mourinho's side since arriving from Southampton?

title: The Papers: 'Carry on Christmas' as PM refuses to scrap rules
description: The front pages focus on whether plans to ease restrictions over Christmas could be scrapped or cut.

title: Peru: Police conduct drugs raid dressed as Santa Claus and elf
description: Police in Peru raid a house dressed as Santa Claus and an elf, and detain a suspected drug dealer.

title: The Archers tackles the 'hidden' connection between disability and modern slavery
description: As The Archers reveal three characters kept as slaves have a learning or mental health disability, how widespread is the problem in the UK?

title: Historic England: Shipwreck and Selfridges on 2020 protected list
description: Historic England has added 423 sites to its National Heritage List in 2020.

title: Vaccine doctors on TikTok: 'Come for the fun, stay for the science'
description: Meet the doctors working on vaccines and providing information about the jabs on TikTok.

title: Great Pyramid: Lost Egyptian artefact found in Aberdeen cigar box
description: The 5,000-year-old piece of wood, originally found in the Great Pyramid in 1872, is said to be "hugely significant".

title: Beirut explosion: The architect rebuilding families' homes for free
description: Joe Salloum and his team are bringing hope, and homes, back to people who live in the poorest areas of Beirut.

title: Kangaroos can 'communicate' with humans, study finds
description: Their behaviour challenges a notion that such abilities come only from domestication, a study finds.

title: 'Fear is the only thing that stops you. I had to give it a try’
description: Three stories of people working in retail who set up new businesses during Covid-19.

title: What are the Christmas Covid rules?
description: Laura Foster explains who you can see and how to stay safe.

title: Our Lives: 'We don't have to be shooting each other'
description: The BBC's Fergal Keane returns to Northern Ireland to see how one community is dealing with the legacy of the Troubles.

title: 'Tier 3 has ruined our dream restaurant opening'
description: With sit-down dining now off the menu in much of England, restaurant owners say they're facing a difficult Christmas.

title: French culture takes centre stage in Covid protest
description: Actors, musicians and theatre directors gather to criticise the decision not to reopen culture venues.

title: 'Precious few joyful tidings' in Germany
description: New restrictions come into force limiting festivities to the smallest of family gatherings.

title: Prato: The Italian town turning rags into new clothes
description: A small Italian town has built its fortune on transforming the world's old scraps into new clothes.

title: Brexit rules put clubs at 'disadvantage' - Man Utd academy boss Cox
description: Manchester United's head of academy Nick Cox says Premier League clubs will be disadvantaged by new Brexit rules on signing young players from overseas clubs.
